page.title: 04Local History - The Levers
page.content: The name{Great Lever}probably derives from the old English word 'laefre' meaning reeds and a family who settled in the area assumed the name {de Lever.}These were the ancestors of the large family of Levers,local landowners, who have been so influential in the history of Bolton. The first Lord Leverhulme, William Hesketh Lever, businessman and benefactor, was a descendant of one branch of this family. {Swan Lane}runs between{Daubhill}and {Great Lever}and according to the O.S. map of 1847 the only roads in the district were{Swan Lane}and{High St. At that time the grounds of{The Pike} the Heywood family residence (now used as the industrial premises of Wm.Wadsworth) covered the whole of the present Swan Lane Housing Estate. { }
